newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Energy refinery closed due to power outage.
newsitem.headline: Japan Energy refinery closed due to power outage.

text.p: Japan Energy Corp said on Friday that its 95,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery in Chita, central Japan, had halted operations due to a power outage on Thursday.
A company spokesman said the refinery's crude distillation unit would resume operation on Saturday.
The Japan Energy spokesman said power supply to the Chita refinery was disrupted before noon yesterday for about 30 minutes.
He said the company had decided to stop all operations at the complex, including operations of a petrochemical production unit, to make emergency checks.
"We halted operation at all the facilities as a precautionary measure," he said.
The spokesman added that the company is taking necessary steps to resume full operation of the refinery.
He could not immediately comment on when the company would resume operation of the petrochemical unit.
Japan Energy does not produce any ethylene at its petrochemical facility in Chita, the spokesman said.
It has facilities to produce an annual 350,000 tonnes of paraxylene and 100,000 tonnes of cyclohexane.
The company also has a 17,000 barrel-per-stream day aromatic recovery unit at the complex.
The spokesman said: "We are checking the petrochemical facilities, and cannot yet say when we can resume operations."
